SEARCH
Module comp3111.examsystem
Package comp3111.examsystem.controller

Class TeacherManagementController

java.lang.Object
comp3111.examsystem.controller.TeacherManagementController
public class TeacherManagementController extends Object
Controller for managing teachers in the HKUST Examination System. Provides functionality to add, update, delete, filter, and view teacher data. Integrates with the database to manage persistent storage and supports validation to ensure data integrity.

  • Constructor Details

    • TeacherManagementController

      public TeacherManagementController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the Teacher Management Controller. Sets up the database connections, loads teacher data, configures the TableView, and establishes event listeners for user interactions.

    • loadTeacherTable

      public List<Teacher> loadTeacherTable()
      Loads teacher data into the TableView. If filters are applied, only matching records are displayed.
      Returns:
      A list of filtered teachers or an empty list if no filters are applied

    • noFilter

      public boolean noFilter()
      Checks whether any filters are currently applied to the teacher table.
      Returns:
      true if no filters are applied, false otherwise.

    • updateTeacher

      public boolean updateTeacher(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Updates the selected teacher's data in the database. Validates the input and shows a confirmation dialog for changes.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event triggered by clicking the "Update" button.
      Returns:
      true if the update is successful, false otherwise.

    • resetFilter

      public void resetFilter(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Clears all filters applied to the teacher table and reloads all data.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event triggered by clicking the "Reset" button.

    • filterTeacher

      public void filterTeacher(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Applies filters to the teacher table based on input criteria.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event triggered by clicking the "Filter" button.

    • deleteTeacher

      public boolean deleteTeacher(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Deletes the selected teacher from the database. Shows a confirmation dialog before performing the deletion.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event triggered by clicking the "Delete" button.
      Returns:
      true if the teacher is successfully deleted, false otherwise.

    • deleteTeacherFromDatabase

      public void deleteTeacherFromDatabase(Teacher teacher)
      Deletes the given teacher from the database. Handles exceptions and displays error messages if the operation fails.
      Parameters:
      teacher - The teacher to delete.

    • clearFields

      public void clearFields()
      Clears all input fields in the teacher management form.

    • refreshTeacher

      public void refreshTeacher(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Refreshes the teacher table by clearing all filters and reloading data. Also clears all input fields.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event triggered by clicking the "Refresh" button.

    • addTeacher

      public void addTeacher(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Adds a new teacher to the database after validating the input. Displays a confirmation dialog before performing the operation.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event triggered by clicking the "Add" button.

    • validateUpdateInput

      public boolean validateUpdateInput(Teacher teacher, List<String> changes)
      Validates the input fields for updating a teacher. Checks for required fields, correct formats, and detects changes in data.
      Parameters:
      teacher - The teacher object to validate against.
      changes - A list to record detected changes in teacher information.
      Returns:
      true if the input is valid, false otherwise.

    • validateAddInput

      public boolean validateAddInput()
      Validates the input fields for adding a teacher. Ensures all required fields are filled and contain valid data.
      Returns:
      true if the input is valid, false otherwise.

    • validateDepartment

      public boolean validateDepartment(String department)
      Validates the department input against a predefined list of valid departments.
      Parameters:
      department - The department input to validate.
      Returns:
      true if the department is valid, false otherwise.

    • validateUsername

      public boolean validateUsername(String username)
      Validates the username input for uniqueness and format. Ensures the username is alphanumeric and does not already exist.
      Parameters:
      username - The username input to validate.
      Returns:
      true if the username is valid, false otherwise.

    • validateAge

      public boolean validateAge(String age)
      Validates the age input for numeric format and range.
      Parameters:
      age - The age input to validate.
      Returns:
      true if the age is valid, false otherwise.

    • updateTeacherInDatabase

      public void updateTeacherInDatabase(Teacher teacher)
      Updates the given teacher's data in the database. Displays a success or error message depending on the outcome.
      Parameters:
      teacher - The teacher object with updated data.

    • addTeacherToDatabase

      public void addTeacherToDatabase()
      Adds a new teacher to the database using the input fields. Displays a success or error message depending on the outcome.
